abstract: FairPoint, which bought Verizon’s landlines and Internet services for $2.3 billion in 2008, has been plagued with customer service and operational problems.
snippet: FairPoint, which bought Verizon’s landlines and Internet services for $2.3 billion in 2008, has been plagued with customer service and operational problems.
lead_paragraph: FairPoint Communications sought bankruptcy protection on Monday after struggling to absorb phone lines purchased from Verizon Communications.

headline.main: FairPoint, Buyer of Verizon Unit, Files for Bankruptcy Protection

abstract: Verizon still wants to sell Apple’s iPhone, said the company’s chief executive, as he discussed the phone company’s better-than-expected earnings.
snippet: Verizon still wants to sell Apple’s iPhone, said the company’s chief executive, as he discussed the phone company’s better-than-expected earnings.
lead_paragraph: It seems that Ivan Seidenberg thinks Steve Jobs has a thick skin.

headline.main: Droid or Not, Verizon Still Wants the iPhone
